title: How to Make Oatmeal Cookie Ice Cream Sandwiches

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/46\/OatmealCookie00_574.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/46\/OatmealCookie00_574.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":287,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":474.0952380952381,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Cream the butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar together in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Use either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, and run the mixer at medium speed.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6e\/OatmealCookie02_321.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6e\/OatmealCookie02_321.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":390,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":644.1904761904761,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Add the eggs and the vanilla.
steps.description: Beat the mixture on medium speed until the ingredients are just incorporated.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fa\/OatmealCookie01_432.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fa\/OatmealCookie01_432.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":298,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":492.1904761904762,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Whisk the flour, baking soda, cinnamon together and in a separate bowl.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7a\/OatmealCookie03_982.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7a\/OatmealCookie03_982.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":357,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":589.9047619047619,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Pour 1/3 of the flour mixture into the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Mix until the dry ingredients are incorporated. Continue adding 1/3 of the dry ingredients at a time until all of the flour mixture is incorporated into the butter mixture.

steps.headline: Stir in the oats and raisins, if you are using them, with a wooden spoon.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b6\/OatmealCookie04_482.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b6\/OatmealCookie04_482.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":283,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":466.85714285714283,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Drop the cookies onto the baking sheets using a tablespoon.
steps.description: Leave 1-1/2” around each cookie so that each has room to spread as it bakes.

steps.headline: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies are a light golden brown.
Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on the stove top for 2 minutes.
Transfer the cookies to wire racks and allow them to cool completely.
steps.description: Use a spatula to loosen the cookies from the parchment paper.

steps.headline: Remove the ice cream from the freezer.
steps.description: Allow it to soften on the counter top for approximately 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Place 1 cookie, with its bottom side facing upward, onto a flat surface.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d3\/OatmealCookie05_424.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d3\/OatmealCookie05_424.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":335,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":553.7142857142857,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Scoop some ice cream onto the cookie using an ice cream scoop or a tablespoon.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8e\/OatmealCookie06_558.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8e\/OatmealCookie06_558.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":337,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":557.3333333333334,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Place a second cookie on top of the ice cream.
steps.description: Press the bottom of the second cookie into the ice cream, which will flatten the ice cream. Ideally, you want to have some ice cream in every bite of the sandwich.

steps.headline: Eat the sandwiches immediately.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can place the sandwiches onto a cookie sheet. Place the cookie sheet in the freezer, freeze the sandwiches until they have hardened, and wrap each individual sandwich in plastic wrap.

text:
Prepare the Cookies Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/46/OatmealCookie00_574.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/46/OatmealCookie00_574.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":287,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":474.0952380952381,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Cream the butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar together in a mixing bowl. Use either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, and run the mixer at medium speed. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/6e/OatmealCookie02_321.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/6e/OatmealCookie02_321.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":390,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":644.1904761904761,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Add the eggs and the vanilla. Beat the mixture on medium speed until the ingredients are just incorporated. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fa/OatmealCookie01_432.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fa/OatmealCookie01_432.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":298,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":492.1904761904762,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Whisk the flour, baking soda, cinnamon together and in a separate bowl. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7a/OatmealCookie03_982.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7a/OatmealCookie03_982.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":357,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":589.9047619047619,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Pour 1/3 of the flour mixture into the wet ingredients. Mix until the dry ingredients are incorporated. Continue adding 1/3 of the dry ingredients at a time until all of the flour mixture is incorporated into the butter mixture. Stir in the oats and raisins, if you are using them, with a wooden spoon. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b6/OatmealCookie04_482.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b6/OatmealCookie04_482.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":283,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":466.85714285714283,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Drop the cookies onto the baking sheets using a tablespoon. Leave 1-1/2” around each cookie so that each has room to spread as it bakes. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies are a light golden brown. Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on the stove top for 2 minutes. Transfer the cookies to wire racks and allow them to cool completely. Use a spatula to loosen the cookies from the parchment paper. Assemble the Sandwiches Remove the ice cream from the freezer. Allow it to soften on the counter top for approximately 10 minutes. Place 1 cookie, with its bottom side facing upward, onto a flat surface. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d3/OatmealCookie05_424.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d3/OatmealCookie05_424.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":335,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":553.7142857142857,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Scoop some ice cream onto the cookie using an ice cream scoop or a tablespoon. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/8e/OatmealCookie06_558.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/8e/OatmealCookie06_558.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":337,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":557.3333333333334,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/Oatmeal-Cookie-Ice-Cream-Sandwiches-517114358 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Place a second cookie on top of the ice cream. Press the bottom of the second cookie into the ice cream, which will flatten the ice cream. Ideally, you want to have some ice cream in every bite of the sandwich. Eat the sandwiches immediately. Alternatively, you can place the sandwiches onto a cookie sheet. Place the cookie sheet in the freezer, freeze the sandwiches until they have hardened, and wrap each individual sandwich in plastic wrap.
